fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models

Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.Model
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VariableDefinitionsAndSharingI, VariableInitialisationI, ModelI, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AtomicModel, CoupledModel

    public abstract class Model
extends java.lang.Object
implements ModelI, java.io.Serializable
    The class Model is the root of the class hierarchy implementing variants of DEVS simulation models for a component plug-in implementing a family of DEVS simulation engines.

    Description

    Models have two major distinct but interrelated definitions: a static definition and a dynamic one. The static definition gives an URI to the model and it declares the model imported and exported events. This information is used for model composition prior to simulation runs. The dynamic part attaches a simulation engine to the model (which can be null if the model is enacted by the simulation engine of its parent or an ancestor coupled model). It also includes a simulation time unit (which at this point is assumed to be the same throughout the simulation model architecture) as well as all the data and methods used to execute the simulation.

    Atomic DEVS simulation models defines the model behaviour in terms of functions, which are translated here in method implementations. These

    Glass-box Invariants

     invariant       uri == null || !uri.isEmpty()
 invariant       simulatedTimeUnit != null
 invariant       simulationEngine == null || simulationEngine.isModelSet()

    Black-box Invariants

     invariant       !isStateInitialised() || getTimeOfNextEvent().equals(Time.INFINITY) || getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract(getCurrentStateTime()).equals(getNextTimeAdvance())

    Created on : 2016-01-15

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • Model

        public Model(java.lang.String uri,
             java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit simulatedTimeUnit,
             SimulatorI simulationEngine)
        create a model instance with the given URI (if null, one will be generated) and to be run by the given simulator (or by the one of an ancestor coupled model if null) using the given time unit for its clock.

        Contract

         pre     uri == null || !uri.isEmpty()
 pre     simulatedTimeUnit != null
 pre     simulationEngine == null || !simulationEngine.isModelSet()
 post    !isDebugModeOn()
 post    getURI() != null && !getURI().isEmpty()
 post    uri == null || getURI().equals(uri)
 post    getSimulatedTimeUnit().equals(simulatedTimeUnit)
 post    getSimulationEngine().equals(simulationEngine)
        Parameters:
        uri - URI of the model.
        simulatedTimeUnit - time unit used for the simulation time of this model.
        simulationEngine - simulation engine enacting the model (can be the same as the one used by the parent coupled model).

      • closed

        public boolean closed()
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        return true if the model is closed.

        Description

        A model is closed if it has no imported event. A model can be considered as closed even if it exports events because they can be executed with their exported events not consumed by any other model.

        Contract

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        closed in interface ModelI
        Returns:
        true if the model is closed (no imported event).

      • initialiseState

        public void initialiseState()
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        initialise the state of the model to make it ready to execute a simulation run with default initial time set to 0.

        Description

        Specific models rarely redefine this method; they should rather redefine the method initialiseState(Time initialTime) with the initial time argument.

        Contract

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    isInitialised()
        Specified by:
        initialiseState in interface ModelI

      • initialiseState

        public void initialiseState(Time initialTime)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        initialise the state of the model to make it ready to execute a simulation run.

        Description

        The standard predefined state initialisation will set the time to the next event. Hence, if a specific model has to perform some initialisations which the first internal transition depends upon, it must first perform them and then call the inherited method using super.

        Contract

         pre     initialTime != null
 pre     initialTime.greaterThanOrEqual(Time.zero(getSimulatedTimeUnit()))
 post    isInitialised()
        Specified by:
        initialiseState in interface ModelI
        Parameters:
        initialTime - time of the simulation when it will start.
        See Also:
        ModelI.initialiseState(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Time)

      • getNextTimeAdvance

        public Duration getNextTimeAdvance()
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        return the duration until the next internal event as previously computed by timeAdvance() but in a side effect free manner.

        Description

        In the DEVS protocol, the function timeAdvance return the duration until the next internal event, but it is assumed to be a pure function. In an object-oriented implementation, the user (who implements timeAdvance) may have to implement it with some side effects on the object representing the model. Hence, it should be called only once each time an internal event is executed. If the user need to access this value again, he/seh must be provided with a side effect free way to do so. This method does exactly that.

        Contract

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        getNextTimeAdvance in interface ModelI
        Returns:
        the duration until the next internal event as previously computed by timeAdvance().
        See Also:
        ModelI.getNextTimeAdvance()

      • getTimeOfNextEvent

        public Time getTimeOfNextEvent()
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        return the time at which the next internal event will happen in a side effect free manner.

        Description

        In the standard purely functional definition of the DEVS protocol, this method would not be required, as it is the addition of the result of the function timeAdvance and the current simulated time of the model. In this object-oriented implementation, the user may implement timeAdvance with some side effects, hence if he/she needs to access this information elsewhere, a side effect free way to do so must be provided. This method does exactly that.

        Contract

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    return != null
        Specified by:
        getTimeOfNextEvent in interface ModelI
        Returns:
        the time at which the next internal event will happen.
        See Also:
        ModelI.getTimeOfNextEvent()
